Some customers choose to wait until [SLOWER PERIOD] when we can expedite. What would work best for your situation?

quality_objections.objection: How do I know the repair will look perfect?
quality_objections.wrong_approach: Just saying 'we guarantee it' without proof
quality_objections.right_approach: That's the right question to ask. Let me show you: [SHOW BEFORE/AFTER PHOTOS OF SIMILAR DAMAGE]. We use [COMPUTERIZED PAINT MATCHING] that reads your exact factory color code. Our [TECHNICIAN NAME/CERTIFICATION] has [X YEARS] experience with [VEHICLE MAKE]. And we back it with a [LIFETIME WARRANTY] on both parts and labor - if you ever see an issue, we make it right. Would you like to see our work area and meet the technician who'd work on your [VEHICLE]?

I'd rather you talk to our past customers than just trust my word. Here's [CUSTOMER NAME] who had [SIMILAR DAMAGE] - would you like their number?

diy_objections.objection: I'm thinking about just living with it / fixing it myself

shopping_objections.right_approach: Absolutely - you should compare. When you're reviewing estimates, make sure you're comparing the same things: are they using OEM or aftermarket parts? What's the warranty length? Is paint blending included? Do they have [CERTIFICATION] for your [VEHICLE MAKE]? We're confident in our value - if another shop offers something we don't, I'd like to know about it. Can I answer any questions that'll help your comparison?

 Fit tolerances can be off by 2-3mm (causes gaps, wind noise)
 Paint adhesion often inferior to OEM
 No crash testing data in most cases
 May void manufacturer warranties on newer vehicles

2021 Honda Accord, aftermarket bumper cover.

Fit issues required 4 hours of additional labor (insurance didn't want to pay).

Customer ended up with gaps you could slide a credit card through.

 Older vehicles (8+ years)
 Non-structural components
 High-quality certified aftermarket (CAPA approved)

 Vehicles under warranty
 Structural components (frame rails, pillars)
 Safety systems (bumper reinforcements with sensors)
 Lease vehicles
 High-value or newer vehicles

Most states allow you to request OEM parts. Insurance may ask you to pay the difference, but they can't force aftermarket.

Get it in writing.

Called the customer immediately.

7. Inspect exhaust for rust holes. Salt accelerates it. Small hole = $200. Collapsed exhaust = $1,200.
8. Get a pre-winter inspection. We check all vulnerable spots. Most shops do it free. Why wouldn't you?
